data.description: This is an important level of baseline water quality testing recommended by SimpleWater. Test your water with this kit and receive a detailed Tap Score Report of the heavy metals and physical properties of your household tap water. This kit includes testing for lead, copper, arsenic, hardness, and much more. View full test details below.
data.mini_desc: Test the most commonly detected contaminants in household tap water.

data.description:
Tap Score's Specialized Bottled Water Testing Package makes it easy to perform laboratory analysis on your favorite bottled water brand. You'll receive a detailed Tap Score report for the bottle you send us, including detailed health risks analysis.

This testing package includes analysis of key water quality parameters chosen by the US FDA and The International Bottled Water Association (IBWA). Fluoride, alkalinity, pH, coliform bacteria, chemicals associated with plastics, and common metals (lead, arsenic, etc.) are all included.

When you purchase this test, you will receive a box with the following contents (per sample):

1x Full instructions
1x Pre-paid shipping label to lab
data.mini_desc: Easy testing of the health properties of your favorite bottled water brand.

data.description: This package covers a wide range of health risks that water utilities sometimes miss, and some they can't catch. Even if water leaving your local treatment plant is clean, it takes a 3-7 day journey to your home through a network of aging pipes that sometimes introduces new contaminants into your water. View test details below.
data.mini_desc: The best way to verify your utility water and the health of your pipes.

data.description:
Test water in any home, site or facility with certified labs.

This UPGRADED Certified Home Loan test includes 40+ additional water health parameters over the regular Certified Home Loan Test.

This test includes:

  • 40+ Additional Parameters not required for home loans but of interest to all homeowners: including pH, hardness, alkalinity, copper, chromium, cadmium, nickel, mercury, barium, manganese, aluminum, chloride, sulfate, fluoride and more.
  • Digital Tap Score ® Report with detailed health risk analysis for each contaminant detected in the sample, pipe health analysis, treatment cost estimates and recommendations, local water quality report for groundwater and utility water, and Tap Score's famous customer support.

This Package is Currently Only Available in the Continental USA.

Contaminants this tests for:

Parameters shaded green are already included in your FHA / VA Certified Loan Report.

General Characteristics

Alkalinity (as CaCO3), Conductivity, Hardness, LSI, pH, Total Dissolved Solids, Turbidity

Metals & Minerals

Aluminum, Antimony, Arsenic, Barium, Beryllium, Boron, Cadmium, Calcium, Chromium (Total), Cobalt, Copper, Iron, Lead, Lithium, Magnesium, Manganese, Mercury, Molybdenum, Nickel, Phosphorous, Potassium, Selenium, Silver, Sodium, Strontium, Thallium, Tin, Titanium, Uranium, Vanadium, Zinc

Anions

Chloride, Fluoride, Nitrate (as N), Nitrite, Sulfate

Pathogens

Coliform, E. coli

This professional laboratory test, recommended by the US Water Systems Council, is designed to target a broad range of harmful contaminants found in US groundwater. Safeguard your home from naturally occurring hazards, industrial waste from agriculture, oil & gas, illegal dumping, and other sources. View test details below.

data.description:
Tap Score's Reverse Osmosis Treatment Water Test is a specialized testing package to help you analyze the health and performance of an installed Reverse Osmosis (RO) water treatment system.

Use this package to diagnose any of the following setup requirements or treatment issues that pertain to proper RO function and maintenance. Results from your testing included in this order will assist in troubleshooting:

  1. Treatment efficacy
  2. Membrane breakthrough, scaling, and other RO system failure symptoms.
  3. Scaling
  4. Bio-fouling
  5. High iron content
  6. High organics content
  7. Chlorine overdosing

For clients wishing to assess overall RO System performance (before and after treatment) then we advise ordering two (2) of these tests to help us compare performance before and after your treatment unit.

Contaminants this tests for:

General Chemistry and Properties 
Alkalinity (as CaCO3) ; Color ; Conductivity ; Grains per gallon ; Hardness ; Hardness (Ca,Mg) ; Hardness (Total) ; Langelier Saturation Index ; Odor ; Sodium Adsorption Ratio ; Total Dissolved Solids ;  pH ;  Total Organic Carbon

Metals and Minerals
Aluminum ; Antimony ; Arsenate ; Arsenite ; Arsenic (Total); Barium ;  Beryllium ; Boron ; Cadmium ; Calcium ; Cadmium ; Calcium ; Cerium ; Chromium (Total) ; Cobalt ; Copper ; Iron ; Lead ; Lithium ; Magnesium ; Manganese ; Mercury ;Molybdenum ; Nickel ; Phosphorous ; Potassium ; Selenium ; Silica ; Silver ; Sodium ; Strontium ; Thallium ; Tin ; Titanium ; Turbidity ; Uranium ; Vanadium ; Zinc 

Ions, Anions, and Inorganics
Bicarbonate ; Bromide ; Carbonate ; Chloride ; Fluoride ; Nitrate (as N) ; Nitrite (as N) ; Sulfate 

Pathogens
Total Coliform ; E. coli 

Volatile Organic Compounds:
1,1 Dichloroethane ; 1,1 Dichloroethylene ; 1,1 Dichloropropene ; 1,1,1 Trichloroethane ; 1,1,1,2 Tetrachloroethane ; 1,1,2 Trichloroethane ; 1,1,2,2 Tetrachloroethane ; 1,2 Dichlorobenzene ; 1,2 Dichloroethane ; 1,2 Dichloropropane ; 1,2,3 Trichlorobenzene ; 1,2,3 Trichloropropane ; 1,2,4 Trichlorobenzene ; 1,2,4 Trimethylbenzene ; 1,3 Dichlorobenzene ; 1,3 Dichloropropane ; 1,3 Dichloropropene ; 1,3,5 Trimethylbenzene ; 1,4 Dichlorobenzene ; 2,2 Dichloropropane ; Benzene ; Bromobenzene ; Bromochloromethane ; Bromodichloromethane ; Bromoform ; Bromomethane ; Chlorine (Free) ; Chlorine (Total) ; Carbon Tetrachloride ; Chlorobenzene ; Chloroethane ; Chloroform ; Chloromethane ; Chlorotoluene 2 ; Chlorotoluene 4 ; Dibromochloromethane ; Dibromochloropropane ; Dibromomethane ; Dichlorodifluoromethane ; Dichloromethane ; Ethylbenzene ; Ethylene dibromide ; Hexachlorobutadiene ; Isopropylbenzene ; Methyl Tertiary Butyl Ether ; Naphthalene ; Styrene ; Tetrachloroethylene ; Toluene ; Total THMs ; Trichloroethylene ; Trichlorofluoromethane ; Vinyl Chloride ; cis 1,2 Dichloroethylene ; m,p Xylene ; n Butylbenzene ; n Propylbenzene ; o Xylene ; p Isopropyltoluene ; sec Butylbenzene ; tert Butylbenzene ; trans 1,3 Dichloropropene
data.mini_desc: Test the effectiveness of your reverse osmosis membrane to the highest standard.

data.description:
This test is part of Tap Score's Fracking Related Water Test Collection 

The Advanced Fracking Test analyzes your water for all the underlying chemical parameters, broadly inclusive of metals, heavy metals, ions and other volatile organic compounds commonly associated with oil and gas activity. These parameters have been selected due to recommendations made by Federal and State guidance documents on safe water testing in areas nearby hydraulic fracturing and oil and gas activity.

If these tests are performed before, during, and after drilling and/or fracturing activity they are intended to demonstrate changes in underlying water quality. Performed only afterward, they'll let you know whether your sample contains potentially harmful chemicals. There is no known fingerprint for hydraulic fracturing in drinking water. As a result, there is likely no testing kit that one can bring to court and conclusively prove cause and effect.

Parameters in the Advanced Fracking Water Test Package

70+ Vol Organics (VOCs), Benzene, Xylene(s), Toluene, Ethylbenzene, pH, TDS
Alkalinity (total), Barium, Chloride, Magnesium, Potassium, Sodium, Calcium, Hardness (total), Iron, Manganese, EC, Total Suspended Solids, Bromide.

You may request for a professional technician to come collect your water sample on-site. The cost for this additional service varies by time and location. However, if enough people in your neighborhood are running the same test, we can eliminate the professional sampling fee. Inquire at hello@simplewater.us for details.
data.mini_desc: Test for a larger range of harmful contaminants that can result from fracking operations.

data.description: This package covers a broad range of health risks that water utilities sometimes miss, and some they can't catch. Even if water leaving your local treatment plant is clean, it takes a 3-7 day journey to your home through a network of aging pipes that sometimes introduces new contaminants into your water. The Extended City Water Test adds testing for Chlorate, five Haloacetic acids, and radioactive particles to the Advanced City Water Test. View test details below.

data.description:
The most comprehensive water test. Consider this water testing package when analyzing your sample for the widest-possible list of chemicals and microbes.

We provide you with all materials and pre-paid return shipping labels. Your order will include multiple sampling vials, bottles, coolers and preservatives along with instructions for properly collecting and returning your samples for analysis.

Special Note:

No truly comprehensive analysis of water chemistry is ever possible since there are nearly infinite chemicals and microbes on the planet! If you have questions about which specialized testing options are not included in this package, just ask us here.
data.mini_desc: The most comprehensive single water testing package offered by Tap Score.
